article:
The following outline is provided as an overview of and guide to forestry:

'[[Forestry]]' â€“ the art and science of managing forests, tree
plantations, and related natural resources. Forest ecosystems have come to be
seen as the most important component of the biosphere, http://www.tutorvista.com/content/biology/biology-
iv/ecosystem/ecosystem-definition.php ecosystem part of biosphere and
forestry has emerged as a vital field of science, natural resource management,
applied art, and technology. The main goal of forestry is to create and
implement socio-environmental systems that allow forests to continue a
sustainable continuation of environmental supplies and services. The challenge
of forestry is to create systems that are socially accepted while sustaining the
resource and any other resources that might be affected. "Forestry." Gale
Encyclopedia of Science. Thomson Gale, 2001. NA. General OneFile. Gale. 12 Oct.
2009 .
